thread.title: Raiders suffer loss to North Polk
thread.title_full: Raiders suffer loss to North Polk

title: Raiders suffer loss to North Polk
text:
Raiders suffer loss to North Polk Published: Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015 11:21 a.m. CDT By Troy Hyde Newton Daily News 
ALLEMAN — In a preview of a Class 3A regional tournament first-round match, Collins-Maxwell/Baxter’s volleyball team had its hands full with North Polk on Tuesday. 
The Comets eeked out a narrow win in the opening set and then cruised to a three-set sweep of the Raiders at home. North Polk won the Heart of Iowa Conference battle 26-24, 25-17, 25-9. 
The Comets are 24-10 overall and 6-1 in league play, while CMB falls to 10-13 overall and 2-5 in conference matches. 
Payge Jurgens led the Raiders with eight kills and five digs, while Bekah Pearson had four kills and Jordynn Wesselink chipped in three kills. 
Kathleen Baldwin dished out 13 assists and had five digs, while Sailor Hinegardner and Toni Spencer each collected 13 digs. Wesselink had nine digs, and she was 12-for-13 in serves with six serves. 
CMB was 44-of-49 in serves. Hinegardner was 10-of-10. 
The Raiders will conclude their regular season at 7 p.m. Thursday when they travel to South Hamilton.
